Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Dashboard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Dashboard
Direct Known Subclasses:
DashboardStub1
public class Dashboard
extends java.lang.Object
Dashboard is formed by a warehouse depot, strongbox and a set of development cards owned by the player. Stored development cards must respect the following rules: -1 they can be stored up to 3 decks, they will be indexed as 1[left], 2[center], 3[right] -2 at the game's begin decks are empty -3 the first card that can be pushed to a deck must be of level 1 -4 card can be added only at the top of a deck -5 a purchased development card can be placed in a deck only if the card at the top has level == purchased card level -1 -6 covered cards can not be used -7 development cards can not be discarded from the dashboard. Different types of production can be triggered from dashboard: development card production, base production and extra production. When a production is selected Dashboard will check if the production is affordable. Once the production is selected and approved by the dashboard, the player can start to choose how to pay each resource needed or change production: after a resource is chosen, there will not be any possibility to revert this operation. The produced resources will be effectively available after the production phase is concluded.

      Parameters:
      deckIndex - selected deck: values from 1
      Returns:
      card selected
      Throws:
      NoCardException - if the deck is empty

    • isDevCardPlaceable

      public boolean isDevCardPlaceable​(int level) throws WrongLevelException
      this method checks if a development card with the specified level can be placed in the dashboard.
      Parameters:
      level - specified level of the development card
      Returns:
      true if the card is placeable, else false
      Throws:
      WrongLevelException

      Returns:

    • addDevelopmentCard

      public void addDevelopmentCard​(DevelopmentCard cardToAdd, int deckPosition) throws InvalidDeckPositionException, WrongLevelException, GameEndedException
      Add the specified card to one of the dashboard's decks specified. The card must be placed over a card that is 1 level lower.
      Parameters:
      cardToAdd - specified card that has to be placed
      deckPosition - : between 1 and 3
      Throws:
      WrongLevelException - level of the card on top of the selected deck isn't 1 below the level of cardToAdd
      InvalidDeckPositionException - if deckPosition isn't an integer between 1 and 3
      GameEndedException

    • addExtraProduction

      public void addExtraProduction​(ExtraProduction extraProd)
      Add the extra production provided by a leaderCard effect
      Parameters:
      extraProd - specified extra production that is added to dashboard.

    • selectExtraProduction

      public void selectExtraProduction​(int extraProduction, Resource resourceOut) throws NotEnoughResourcesException, ProductionStartedException, ProductionUsedException
      this method selects the extra Production way of producing benefits: this method do not produce anything, it verifies that this production can be actually be performed, and then memorize this choice.
      Parameters:
      extraProduction - is the index position in which the extra production that has to perform is stored in extraProductionList .
      resourceOut - is the resource that is supposed to be produced at the end of the production.
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException - if the dashboard can not find resources needed for the production.
      ProductionStartedException - if a resource has already been spent for another production selected before, and it has not finished yet.
      ProductionUsedException - if the extra production has already been used.

    • selectBaseProduction

      public void selectBaseProduction​(java.util.Map<Resource,​java.lang.Integer> resourceCost, Resource resourceOut) throws NotEnoughResourcesException, ResourceCostException, ProductionStartedException, ProductionUsedException
      this method selects the base Production way of producing benefits: this method do not produce anything, it verifies that this production can be actually be performed, and then memorize this choice.
      Parameters:
      resourceCost - are the resources chosen to be spent during the production.
      resourceOut - is the resource that is supposed to be produced at the end of the production.
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException - if the dashboard can not find resources needed for the production.
      ResourceCostException - if the Map of resources is not composed by 2 resources.
      ProductionStartedException - if a resource has already been spent for another production selected before, and it has not finished yet.
      ProductionUsedException - if base production has already been used.

    • selectCardProduction

      public void selectCardProduction​(int deckIndex) throws InvalidDeckPositionException, NotEnoughResourcesException, NoCardException, ProductionStartedException, ProductionUsedException
      this method selects the development card Production way of producing benefits: this method do not produce anything, it verifies that this production can be actually be performed, and then memorize this choice.
      Parameters:
      deckIndex - specified index of the card that has to perform the production.
      Throws:
      InvalidDeckPositionException - if the deck does not exist.
      NotEnoughResourcesException - if the dashboard can not find resources needed for the production.
      NoCardException - if the specified deck has no cards at the moment.
      ProductionStartedException - if a resource has already been spent for another production selected before, and it has not finished yet.
      ProductionUsedException - if the selected card has already been used.

    • takeFromDepot

      public void takeFromDepot​(Resource resource) throws NotEnoughResourcesException, RequirementsSatisfiedException, InvalidResourceException
      this method is used to take a specified resource from warehouse depot in order to pay the actual production cost of an already selected production.
      Parameters:
      resource - specified resource that has to be taken from the warehouse depot.
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException - if the selected resource can not be found in warehouse depot.
      RequirementsSatisfiedException - if the requirements are already satisfied or there is not any production selected.
      InvalidResourceException

    • takeFromStrongbox

      public void takeFromStrongbox​(Resource resource) throws NotEnoughResourcesException, RequirementsSatisfiedException, InvalidResourceException
      this method is used to take a specified resource from strongbox in order to pay the actual production cost of an already selected production.
      Parameters:
      resource - specified resource that has to be taken from the strongbox.
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException - if the selected resource can not be found in strongbox.
      RequirementsSatisfiedException - if the requirements are already satisfied or there is not any production selected.
      InvalidResourceException

    • takeFromExtraSlot

      public void takeFromExtraSlot​(Resource resource) throws NotEnoughResourcesException, RequirementsSatisfiedException, InvalidResourceException
      this method is used to take a specified resource from an extraSlot in order to pay the actual production cost of an already selected production.
      Parameters:
      resource - specified resource that has to be taken from an extraSlot.
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException - if the selected resource can not be found in any extraSlot.
      RequirementsSatisfiedException - if the requirements are already satisfied or there is not any production selected.
      InvalidResourceException

    • activateProduction

      public int activateProduction() throws NoProductionAvailableException
      Activate the production selected in this round.
      Returns:
      number of faithPoints earned during the production.
      Throws:
      NoProductionAvailableException - if a production has not selected yet or if not all the resources to pay have been already selected.

    • checkDevRequirement

      public boolean checkDevRequirement​(int cardsNumber, int cardsLevel, Color color) throws WrongLevelException
      Check leaderCards Development requirements
      Parameters:
      cardsNumber - quantity of cards required
      cardsLevel - : from 0 to 3: if level is 0 it means that cardsLevel actually is not a requirement.
      color - development card color that has to be searched
      Returns:
      true if requirement is satisfied
      Throws:
      WrongLevelException - if cardsLevel isn't between 0 and 3

    • checkResRequirement

      public boolean checkResRequirement​(int resourceNumber, Resource resource)
      Check if the indicated resource is available: resources which will be considered during the research come from strongbox, warehouse depot and eventually extra slots
      Parameters:
      resourceNumber - quantity of resources required
      resource - specific resource that has to be searched
      Returns:
      true if requirement is satisfied, else false.

    • checkResources

      public boolean checkResources​(java.util.Map<Resource,​java.lang.Integer> resources)
      this method checks if the owner of this dashboard can afford to spend the specified resources.
      Parameters:
      resources - specified resources in a Map where Resource is a key and the value is an Integer indicating quantity of the Resource.
      Returns:
      true if all the resources can be spent, else false.

      Returns:
      the selected dashboard's warehouse depot.

    • getResourcesToPay

      public java.util.ArrayList<Resource> getResourcesToPay()
      This method lists all the resources that have not been paid yet in order to activate a production.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of resources that has to be paid: the same resource can appears multiple times in this ArrayList.

    • getResourcesToPayMap

      public java.util.Map<Resource,​java.lang.Integer> getResourcesToPayMap()

    • getBenefitsToProduce

      public java.util.Map<Benefit,​java.lang.Integer> getBenefitsToProduce()
      This method lists all the benefits that have to be produced due to a production activation.
      Returns:
      a Map containing Benefits to be produced as Key and Integers as values indicating quantity to be produced.

    • refreshProductions

      public void refreshProductions()
      This method makes the dashboard forget about productions used.

    • refreshState

      public void refreshState()
      it clears all the resources that must be paid, benefits to be produced and all the productions activated.

    • automatizePayment

      public void automatizePayment()
      it pays all the resources needed for the selected production.

      Returns:
